page.title: 10WOODMAN'S FARM-PIG FARMING
page.content:
About 2000 pigs are reared on the farm in a purpose-built shed which is best described as functional, cheap, but not attractive.The pigs are bought cheaply simply for fattening. They are fed on almost any food the farmer can obtain: there seemed to be no system as in beef or dairy farming methods that we studied.
The government seems to have less impact on this type of farming than on others we studied there are no grants or subsidies for pig farming though there is a grant of approx. Â£6 per head for the few sheep on the farm.
This farmer does not live on his farm, but lives 2 miles away at Wickham. Like many others in the area that we spoke to, he seems to own his land.
